meanings.definition: To throw eggs at someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The mischievous kids were egging the old house on Halloween night.
meanings.sent2: The protesters were egging the building to show their disapproval.
meanings.sent3: The chickens were egging each other on to see who could lay the most eggs.
meanings.sent4: The storm was egging the waves to crash against the shore with great force.
meanings.sent5: The chef was egging the pan to prevent the pancakes from sticking.

meanings.definition: To encourage or provoke someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: His friends were egging him to try the daring jump at the skate park.
meanings.sent2: The coach was egging the team on to give their best performance in the game.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were egging each other on to see who could finish their chores first.
meanings.sent4: The music was egging the crowd to dance and have a great time at the concert.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was egging the students to participate actively in the class discussion.
